tasks.task: Strawberry Variety Evaluation and Farming Practices
subtasks: Note Camarosa's large size and potential issues with customer visibility and disease inoculum
Compare Camino Real's compact size for improved pesticide coverage and potential higher plant density
Evaluate Ruby June's low stolon production and its implications for labor costs and management
Measure yield data of Camarosa, Camino Real, and Ruby June across seasons
Assess berry size consistency and cull rates
Examine soluble solids (sweetness) and flavor profiles, noting inconsistencies
Analyze anthocyanin content in Ruby June compared to other varieties

tasks.task: Recommendations for Alternative Strawberries in Alabama
subtasks: Suggest Camino Real and Ruby June as potential substitutes for Camarosa
Address Camino Real's variability in environmental stress tolerance
Emphasize importance of timely plant ordering and preparation
Remind farmers to test soil early for timely bed preparation
Provide contact for plug producer lists (Dixie Green, Greenway)
Encourage early ordering from trusted growers to secure desired varieties
Highlight the critical timing for ordering and avoiding last-minute delays
